title: Marshall on help for Europe - compare

content.question: The policies advocated by Marshall had most in common with which of the following developments in other periods in United States history?

choices.label: The expansion of a market economy in the early 1800s, which shaped a distinctive middle class
The attempts by the federal government to foster economic opportunities for former slaves after the Civil War
The emergence of political machines in the late 1800s, which provided economic and social services to urban residents
The forcing of American Indians onto reservations by the United States government following the extension of White settlement

content.answer: The attempts by the federal government to foster economic opportunities for former slaves after the Civil War

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
